utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Hello.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Hello.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Hi.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Good afternoon.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Hi, I'm- Good afternoon.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I'm Jeanne and I am guide number two.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Who is calling please?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Hi Jeanne, my name is June.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um and I'm parti~

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: June?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yap.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And I'm participant number thirty-three.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Three three, yes?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, that's correct.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: How can I help you, June?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Hi Jeanne.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um, I will be s~ %uh I just got married last %uh month

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: and %uh my husband and I is planning for an Asian tour for our honeymoon.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um, now, %uh it just so happen that we're just- we're kind of thinking of staying to Singapore %um for at least two nights.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Would you be able to help me with that?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh, what sort of %uh hotel are you looking at?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um you mean %um hotel categories?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, that's right. %Uh-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: What-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well we're a kind- we're actually working on a budget. %Um.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh I'm not really sure and familiar with your hotel categories that you have there in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It will be our first time.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But if you could work on the budget that we have, that would be great.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And that is?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: What is your budget?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yep.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um we're working on one thousand Singaporean dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: One thousand dollars for the both of you?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: For the both of us.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That should include our meals, our trips and everything.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um so maybe I gave you a hotel that's not so expensive.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Would you like to go to hotel in Chinatown?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's a boutique hotel in a conservation shophouse.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's not like a big fat grand hotel that we get in town, you know.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh this is more personal.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I see Jeanne.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Now, my concern is how far would that be from the airport?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh not very far.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Shall I show you the airport map first then?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Sure.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um shall there'll be %um a person or a ride that could pick us up %uh from the hotel- %uh from the airport going to the hotel?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Or %um where will- we take a subway?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's easier.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh actually it's a- you save money and you save time in the sense that you don't have to wait for people to pick you out.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's more exciting also because you see the locals.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Ah, okay, you- what are you seeing is a portion of the Mass Rapid Transit.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you see the map with the four colours?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So where you get this little round dots that joint up are the intersections of the different lines.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: When you come in you are at number three on the right-hand side of your screen.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And that is the East-West Line

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh Chinatown is on the purple line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you see it?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Purple line?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Ah okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes %uh- Where you see number six and go you up to Outram Park and then you go down to Chinatown one more stop and that is Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you take %uh the subway to town.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And it's not all the way subterranean.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It is above ground, so you get a bit of sightseeing right up until Kallang which- can you see it on the map?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: On the green line?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, I'm seeing it right now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There's a- So after you pass there %uh you would go from Kallang down towards the purple line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You see Outram Park?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you go out up one stop to Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So there will be %um at least two drop-offs for me from the airport?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: You mean to say that %um I need to take the East-West Line until the Kallang and then drop-off there and ride another railway?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No. %Uh I'm just saying that up to Kallang you can see- it's up above ground.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: A few metres.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can see the area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then the ground it goes underground %uh and so Chinatown area is busy.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So all that is underground and also up to Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So when you switch, you just get off your train.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There will be announcements to tell you are coming to an interchange.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You %um follow the directional signs whether you're going up the stairs or down the stairs, you just switch and most likely you go further deeper into the ground.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you have to take the escalator down.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you take it to Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Ah okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um now that I'm seeing the map,

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %um where is the city centre?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh, Chinatown is where we have a large congregation of Chinese but we also have one of the oldest Hindu temples in Chinatown and %uh also have mosque and churches there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There's a Methodist church in that area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Further along the line is Little India which is two stops- three stops up North.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh there you can %uh soak in the Indian atmosphere.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Ah okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And, okay, to show you the relation to the rest of the town.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, wait.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you take the purple line down south can you see number six on the map?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Bottom left-hand side?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yap.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's Harbourfront and that faces Sentosa Island %uh where we had-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What's Sentosa Island?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is that like a real island?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Beaches.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, it's a real island.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: A beach?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's an Island with beaches but there- there's also a road link that you can go over

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh after I settle your hotel, you just tell me what you are interested in.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yap.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I just want to know %um where in this map would you find the Merlion?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, the Merlion is- okay on the same map, can you see %uh- can you see Clarke Quay?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's the stop from which you can walk towards the Merlion.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh that's nice.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I think %um being in Chinatown would be a perfect choice then.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Chinatown, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And if you- since we're on the map, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Later you tell me what are the other attractions that you like to visit What is the-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well, %um Merlion is the only one that %uh we know about Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um my husband would love to %um play golf.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do you golf courses available nearby?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh, we have golf courses on Sentosa Island.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But %uh let me first %uh show you the Merlion that you are talking about.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So the MRT map, the map for the trains, don't show you the location of our rivers.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but here where you see the blue on the map that is formerly just the entrance to the river.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It is now closed in and it's a reservoir.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The Merlion is- do you see a little I there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you see?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh, so that's the location of Merlion Park and that's where the Merlion is.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Is the half fish and half lion %uh- first emblem of the Singapore Tourism Board, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is that %um- is going to that park for free?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And- yo- Yes it's for free all the time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Day and night.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Nice.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That sounds good.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um, now, 'cause I've-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: as I've mentioned we're only gonna be there for two nights.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that's basically- we're arriving %um around six P.M. and then %uh we're gonna be staying the day after then we're gonna have an overnight and we're leaving at the following day.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So we'll basically have a very short stay in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um if you could suggest some activities that we could do.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So as I have mentioned that my husband would love to be- to have a little tee-off time during the morning and then %um in the middle of- perhaps in the middle of the day if we could have %um, you know, %uh sightseeing.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And then of course at night %uh perhaps I'd go shopping and %uh try out some %um very good restaurants around.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh huh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me try and get you %uh places where you can golf in Singapore first.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yap.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh so how much would the hotel be again?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh hotel is a little over a hundred dollars I think.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Just a minute %uh.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, maybe this one is very accessible.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is also on the bay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: On the bay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So will that be near the Merlion?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, near the Merlion.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But %uh you may have to take a taxi there because %uh it is along the highway.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How much would the taxi fare be from our hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: From your hotel, it depends if you're going during peak hours in the morning there's a surcharge.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But it should not be more than ten dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's a very nice area because it's right next to the bay and so you can see the sea %uh right there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um, could you show me how much that would be?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, I'm trying to find it here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So how is your day going so far Jeanne?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's fine.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's a fine day in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No rain.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's a bit shady here.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh got cloudy skies and %um rain is pouring a little bit.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But pretty good.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, we have also %uh a bit of hazy skies %uh overcast.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I'm trying to find the price of this for you.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, that's fine.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh just a minute.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How long have you been %um a tourist guide %uh Jeanne?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: A little more than twenty years.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Wow that's nice.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh let me see, huh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: A lot of changes in Singapore, a lot of new things.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh that's nice to hear.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can come back every year and you will get new attractions to see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Just a moment.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Sure, that's fine.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, these are the rates.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh is it a weekend or weekday?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Did I ask you- you said June, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You haven't quite fixed the days.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um well actually we're spending %um an Asian tour.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So perhaps we're eyeing around %um the ninth of April.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So- Oh!

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh sorry.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: June is your name.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Ninth of April up 'til?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So we'll be arriving at the ninth, tenth, o~ oh until the eleventh.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So we're checking out on the eleventh.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Eleventh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Eleventh, yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh can you tell me off-hand is the ninth a weekend or a weekday?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I believe that's a Monday.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So the ninth, yes, it's a Monday.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you're checking out.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So good.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's a non-weekend %uh timing so you are more likely to get

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh to book your %uh golf session because it's- would be a day where people work.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So how much would that be?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I'm seeing there weekdays for an eighteen hole is seventy five dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh that's for Singaporeans and Permanent Residents.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You would be in the category of hundred and fifteen dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: 'Cause you're a visitor.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, so you do have foreign rates as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, we do for the golf courses.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and I think there's some membership if they joined %uh for Singaporeans where they get some discount.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Ah I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, %uh would you know we~ what time of the day we can start?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We had the timings earlier, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm not really sure.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh le~

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But definitely %um we're hoping to take the golf %um- a little- a golf- the golf play around %um six A.M. perhaps?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Six A.M.?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Would that be- Yap.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I think it's still-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Would that be possible?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think it's still dark.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You want the eighteen hole?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It~ Okay, eighteen hole, you want to book the timing, is that right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What times can we %um start with the game?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Six o'clock it is still dark in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so I don't think you can %uh book a course at that time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: See, it's seven o'clock.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Ah okay, seven o'clock.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But seven o'clock would be okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's not too bad at all.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh huh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, it's good because at that time it is very cool still.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The sun will come out %uh about nine and by ten it gets a bit warm.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So the following are the revised tee times for Wednesday.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But we're actually gonna have that on a Tuesday.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Would you have a Tuesday time?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I thought these are normal times.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh what you see here.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So those are just normal times?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This- Yes %uh- oh so do you need to see for Wednesday.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So for some reason on Wednesdays, they have a different timing.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you're gonna play golf on Tuesday, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, what else would you like to know?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um so %uh how much would %uh our- can I have a look at %um your hotel offers?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, you want to see the hotel?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me get your hotel for you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you okay with Chinatown?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think that would be a good choice.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um o~ is it safe there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's very safe, it's very convenient.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Your Singapore is a Singapore Tourism Board website that you can go to to help plan your tours.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So- We're-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Just give us a-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Just a give us a while for it to come on screen.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh what were you going to ask me?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I hope that the hotel is not that %um- not on the range of %uh %um like a motel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh what do you mean %uh like a motel?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Like %um- where in you have a very small room.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the rooms are small in Chinatown and in Little India because they occupy what used to be shophouses.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh hotels what they do is they %uh- the owners buy up several %uh units of these of shophouses and convert them into hotels.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I see.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But let me show you a picture %uh of the hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you see here?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, I'm trying to look at your hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This %uh up.

utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because in Chinatown, after you put down your bags you just walk out and there are lots of places to eat.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, but that would be %um- we're already tired by that time.

utterances.speaker: Tourist

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I'm gonna go to full list.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So lounges, so there is really no %um restaurant in that hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Not in the hotel but in the vicinity plenty of places to eat.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh why the restaurants don't- %uh why the hotels they don't provide food is because I think the guest prefer to just go out and try %uh either street food or food from the cafés and restaurants nearby.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Ah, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You might be able to get the %um concierge to buy something for you from somewhere nearby and just pay him for it.

utterances.transcript: Oh okay then.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.transcript: Oh okay.

utterances.transcript: Oh so it is decorated in traditional style %uh with %uh with traditional porcelain ware and there on the side you have tourist brochures that you can pick-up.

utterances.transcript: This is a traditional set of %uh tables that we used to have in our kitchen.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can have breakfast in your kitchen, marble table and two chairs.

utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There is another hotel by the river if you want to be on the riverfront, is called the Gallery Hotel.

utterances.transcript: There's another Furama- you want to be in the middle of Chinatown?

utterances.transcript: I wanna be in the middle of the city

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: so that I can %um be readily accessible to the attractions.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is also in the city.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Is just %uh not as convenient as the previous hotel that I showed you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because, the Chinatown stop on the subways stops exactly there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh here it is better if you are tired of walking, you can take a bus to connect with the trains to reach your hotel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So which stop from the railways- which railway station shall I shop in order for me to get a bus?

utterances.transcript: You just stop at the City Centre and then you get out and you take one bus number one nine five and it will bring you to your hotel in about fifteen minutes or so.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Ten minutes actually.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if we have red lights along the way then its fifteen minutes.

utterances.transcript: %Um what's the name of the %um station at the City Centre?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The station is City Hall.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's a major station and it's in a business district So you don't even need to take that train if you outside your hotel if you take the buses, %uh you can go to where City Hall is and you can walk around the area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We have historic buildings there, we have a big theatre and concert hall %uh by the bay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.transcript: Yah 'cause I'm thinking that if I'm gonna get this hotel-

utterances.transcript: hello!

utterances.transcript: Oh what you se~ Yes, I'm here.

utterances.transcript: Yap.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I'm just thinking that if I'm gonna get that hotel,

utterances.transcript: %um coming from the airport of course %um I'm gonna take the subway or the East-West Line.

utterances.transcript: %Uh which station should I drop off?

utterances.transcript: Oh you drop off at City Hall Station and you take bus number one nine five.

utterances.transcript: %Hm okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright then.

utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, I think that just %uh that %uh hotel is more likely that we're gonna take.

utterances.transcript: %Um, now, once we get- %uh as you've mentioned, do you have anything else that we- after we take the golf course?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I have now listed in my plan to go to Marina Bay Golf Course.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh what other %uh attractions could you suggest for sightseeing that is nearby from Marina bay?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %hm. Oh %uh would- Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So from Marina Bay if you %uh come out and go to the %uh City Centre area that's where we have the Esplanade Theatres on the Bay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's %uh a big theatre and concert hall.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, but that would be %um too lengthy of a time to stay at the theatre.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Just of course we're gonna watch some things, some shows and %um I think we don't have much time to watch some shows.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh I'm not suggesting you watch shows.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I'm just suggesting you have a look at the place %uh and take photos %uh because you are looking out at the Marina Bay Sands Hotel which is quite iconic and the %uh bay right in front of the Singapore River.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that's where many people like to take photographs.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And if you want to have a meal, you can have it %uh inside

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh the shopping where the %uh theatres are.

utterances.transcript: Can you see the pictures here now?

utterances.transcript: %Ah okay.

utterances.transcript: Oh yah, it looks like a durian.

utterances.transcript: Durian, yes.

utterances.transcript: That's what it's been called locally.

utterances.transcript: But, the architect meant it to look like the top of the microphones.

utterances.transcript: %Ah oh yah.

utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.transcript: No, I just thought that it looks like a Durian

utterances.transcript: %Uh so it's a nice place to take photographs, to walk around, %uh because-

utterances.transcript: Okay, so the- I can actually go inside, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, you can go inside.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh we sometimes do have lunchtime concerts.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but that would depend on %um the Esplanade's %uh schedule.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's about only forty five minutes or one hour during lunchtime.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's to encourage locals to step into our concert hall.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that you know later on they would buy the concert tickets and attend that concerts.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So- I see.

utterances.transcript: %Um Jeanne, %um how long do you think %uh would be enough for us to stay inside?

utterances.transcript: %Uh well it depends on what you are interested in.

utterances.transcript: %Uh lots of great shops here and %uh chocolate shop

utterances.transcript: and places where you can have a drink or a meal.

utterances.transcript: But if you don't do all that,

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: you just take a look and then you walk along the outside.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can see by the ri~ %uh by the theatre, you can reach the Marina Bay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So maybe ten, fifteen minutes inside and outside to photograph it

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: and then you walk to Merlion.

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.transcript: %Um %hm fifteen minutes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So around- perhaps we're alloca~ so we're gonna be finishing our tea golf around nine.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So we're perhaps if it's very near Marina Bay %uh going to the Esplanade would take us around fifteen minutes?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And then %uh we're gonna spend at the Esplanade around- so that's nine fifteen.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: We're gonna be there until eleven perhaps.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, you take your photographs, you walk slowly and have a look soak in the atmosphere.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Or ten thirty and then %uh we can walk going to Merlion from here?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, you can walk and %uh I do that as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because, %uh you know, I don't even think you can take a bus there it's so near.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Right.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, so picture taki~ what else can we do at the Merlion Park?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: From the Merlion Park, I suggest you get across to %uh Boat Quay and Clarke Quay.

utterances.transcript: What can we do there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh see here, you are at the bay in front of the river.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh later you %uh walk along the Singapore River itself.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And if you are energetic, you can walk all the way home to your hotel.

utterances.transcript: Well, I can deal with that.

utterances.transcript: I don't think my husband will be very happy about that.

utterances.transcript: Well, he can play golf, you know.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: He is a fit.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh if you did it at seven in the morning, it's very nice.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I have done it once before.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you come across some joggers, some people walking their dogs.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um okay, so we're gonna stop at Merlion- %um at the Merlion Park, do we have %um restaurants available there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, there are restaurants %uh nearby at- because there's a big hotel called the Fullerton Hotel and they own the place in front of the hotel by the river- oh sorry, by the bay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's called One Fullerton and there are lots of %uh places you could have a meal.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How much would the range of the meals be in that place?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That place- %uh depends on what you order actually.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh if you go inside the hotel and you eat at the Jade Restaurant, it would cost you a bit more.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Maybe %uh sixty or seventy dollars a person.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you walk along the Singapore River,

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %um there are places that serve lunch at prices that office workers can afford.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because many office workers in the area behind, can you see the river on the map?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So on the south banks of the river where you see North Canal Road?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Behind that area is the business district.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And some of them would actually eat %uh along the Singapore River.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can get a meal there fifteen dollars, twenty dollars per person.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: More than enough for the both of you.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I don't think that walking along would be a really %um commendable for my husband.

utterances.transcript: Do you have %um car rentals available?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You know?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: From the Merlion, you can board a boat.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh these are electric boats that ply the bay and the river and they also do like a taxi service alo~ with the stops along the river.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there is one stop

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: at the back of your hotel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm that's nice.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How much is the boat ride?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh %um if you're taking the taxi ride, it's under ten dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh if you do a tour with them going around the bay then it's about fifteen dollars or so.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So were gonna have lunch perhaps nearby the Merlion.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um do you suggest any ho~ %um promising %um restaurants nearby aside from the Jade Restaurant?

utterances.transcript: %Uh just by the river, there are restaurant.

utterances.transcript: I forget the name %um but it was a very good Japanese restaurant if you like Japanese food.

utterances.transcript: %Uh we want authentic Singaporean food.

utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Singaporean food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Hm let me see.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: At One Fullerton.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me check out One Fullerton %uh where- see if they have anything that what- is what I would consider Singapore food, huh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The One Fullerton areas for food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The hotel is the Fullerton Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But One Fullerton is the name of the area opposite where we have all the restaurants.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that is just across the hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, of the- okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oops!

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I got the wrong spelling there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.transcript: Singaporean food, you do you like seafood?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Seafood, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, there's one right next to the Merlion.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And this is a website %uh put up by a Singaporean who checks out places to eat.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Palm Beach.

utterances.transcript: So- So you can get crabs there, you can get a %uh- you- have you heard of chicken- %Uh sorry, %uh chili crab?

utterances.transcript: %Um perhaps.

utterances.transcript: Would you kne~ would you tell me something more about it?

utterances.transcript: can you take hot food?

utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.transcript: Both of us love hot food.

utterances.transcript: So, chili hot, huh?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So chili crab is %uh the big crab that is cooked in chili sauce and tomato sauce with onions and egg and a little bit of flour.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So here you see some pictures of it.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Wow.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you're thinki~

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That looks delightful.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes it's very nice.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's finger licking good, so, you must use your hands to eat.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Ah okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's quite acceptable, yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That's nice.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you can tell the waitress that you don't want to take too hot chili and then they will tone it down.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But if you want more chili, you can tell them also.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So, right.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So we have half of the day planned.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um right after lunch, that would be around two P.M. what would be a good thing to do?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can %uh- what other places- what are your interest besides %uh the golf?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well, for me, I plan to shop.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But, %um I don't think at two P.M. that would be a really nice %um time to shop 'cause it might be too hot.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh if you do street shopping, then it's a bit warm.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But if you're going to the shopping malls, %uh- let me try and get you- do you want to go shopping along the more expensive areas or are you thinking of street shopping?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um, well, street shopping would do I think.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: 'Cause %um I've heard that's really expensive when we go to shopping malls in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh shopping malls not really expensive %uh in the sense that the shopping malls have a mix of expensive as well as not so expensive %uh items.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Street shopping I think in Chinatown you can do it in the evening.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But around two P.M. what do you think we do- what do you suggest for us to do?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me tra~

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, if you want to get away from the heat and near to your hotel, you can visit a museum just across the road.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh nice.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Across the road of our hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, the Asian Civilisations Museum.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do you have a Singapore museum where we can actually %um %uh learn about Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me %uh get you this museum first.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you talking about history is the Singapore History Museum.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh this one will give you %uh only Singapore, the history around the river.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That means the early history of Singapore and what went on by the %uh- sorry.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Asian-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm not sure.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I have seen this %um documentary from %um National Geographic.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um there is a museum where you have bottles of water on the wall because %um they've said that %um water was very %um- a very important resource way back then as it you actually import that.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is that true?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Civilisation.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, we import water.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that museum is %uh- it's by the bay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's called Marina Barrage.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Are you interested in that?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, I think I'd like to see that wall with a lot of mineral %uh water bottles.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's just the empty water bottles, huh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: used for the decor it's called the Marina Barrage.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And- %Uh it will tell you about the bay that you're looking at right in front of you at the Merlion.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So, can you see the pictures there?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um but tiny.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, tiny.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So here you go.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there is %uh or I don't know whether you can call it a museum but when you enter, it gives you the history of Singapore in fact and the development along the rivers.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh all the rivers.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Our efforts like cleaning up all our rivers because now some of the rivers flow into this area that is called the Marina Bay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And that's how we are able to close it off.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you see it at this picture here?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Can you enlarge that for me?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, I'm trying to enlarge it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's a little bit slow.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is it free to enter that barrage?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, it's free.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's designed a little bit like %uh the number nine.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm what's the significance of number nine?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Well for- well it's just the architect's design.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But %uh for a chi~ yah, for Chinese, we do like number nine also.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We have to wait a little bit %uh for the picture to appear

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh well, that's fine.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That's fine.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um, so we're going to- I think this would be a good time for us to check this out after lunch.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So perhaps around four o'clock

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: we can go straight to shopping.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do you- what's the shopping district called?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We have many shopping districts.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The one that's most famous is in downtown Orchard Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there you get many high-end brands.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: As well as %uh medium priced.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh another place you might want to check out is opposite to Sentosa Island and it's called VivoCity.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's very popular everyday %uh especially in the evenings after work.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Can I get-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: VivoCity and Harbourfront.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm Harbourfront.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um can I get %um tokens like a souvenir items from those shops?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh, you can get them there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But you might want to- if you want to save money, you go down to Chinatown and you would be able to %uh buy more things with your money.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That's nice.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That's very cost effective.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So during the evening, what do you suggest

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %um for us to take our dinner?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I wanted something special this time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you might want to have dinner %um- let me see, huh?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Marina Barrage.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Do you want to have dinner at %uh the Marina Bay Sands?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's an integrated resort with very high-end %uh restaurants.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How much would that- would do you think would cost us to have dinner there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh- Maybe two, three hundred dollars for the both of you.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Two to three hundred dollars for the both of us?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, so I'm just trying to think.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: A hundred and seventy three, so that would cost us around %uh three hundred forty six and then we're gonna have three hundred.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that would mean we're only left with less than four hundred dollars to spend.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, that said so.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But here you get sort of- can you see fine dining and casual dining?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you don't pick fine dining it wouldn't be so expensive then.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um anything else that you think would not be too costy, but still going to be very romantic for the both of us?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me think, huh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me find a- A hotel maybe at the- how much- what is your budget?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well, as I've said %um for the entire trip %um we're only working on one thousand Singaporean dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that's for everything.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So your budget for this good meal, that doesn't cost too much?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Doesn't cost too much.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But as I've said %um I'm good with the hotel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that's one hundred seventy three for per night.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That- if I'm going to ha~ stay for two nights that would mean three hundred forty six in total.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I'm left with like less than nine- %um six hundred dollars to spend for the whole day.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um a lot of places that you've mentioned %um will be

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh huh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And your- Your golf is a hundred and fifteen so you have to take that off.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yap, so I'm left with four hundred.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you have %uh- Four hun~ five-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Four-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Four hundred.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, roughly four hundred dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Double- five- Five hundred and thirty five dollars, and you don't want to spend it all on dinner?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, of course.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Ah okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: 'Cause of course we're still going to shop.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm going to shop.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So perhaps shopping would be around two hundred?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Two hundred, three-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Two hundred.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can eat here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So two hundred if you take it out for shopping you still have three hundred over dollars for a fine meal.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can even do fine dining here.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, but of course we still have to take %um transportation and all this stuff.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Tips and anything.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So, you know,  we don't wanna be too tight.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I see.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, we got the menu for you here and should have a price there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you read it?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: The price, not really clear for me.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can't see the price.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is that the one below each of the meal?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Like this mesclun salad is fourteen dollars?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Fo~ The- Yes, that is right.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Ah okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So, you see, if you don't order of full meal from salad, soup, main meal and then have a dessert and coffee it wouldn't cost you so much.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's- if you go the all- the full works with wine and everything then it would be more expensive.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, but this Marina Bay Sands is really good.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, it's %uh the chefs are well-known and the ambiance is good.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I don't know what that hotel or what that place is but %um I have seen pictures of a floating building

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And it's-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's not really floating.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It looks floating.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's a three towers %uh on the opposite side of the bay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So from where you are looking at it, sometimes it looks like it's floating.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, you are right.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So what's that place?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that is the hotel and integrated resort.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we have a casino there actually.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What hotel is that?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's the Marina Bay Sands.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But %uh-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh so we're on that place.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: know it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, that's right.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Ah okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So are- Is that restaurant that one at the top?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh whether it's at the top of the hote~ it may not be right at the top because they have a swimming pool.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It may be there, I'm not very sure.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Wow, it would be amusing to have dinner at that place.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: For that I can see the entire Singapore, I believe.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, Bistro Moderne I'm not sure.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: A few hotels are at the top but I cannot confirm with you whether this one is at the top.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Ah okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well, %um I think I've got pretty good idea of my tour.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh you know what, you've been very helpful Jeanne.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think I've got everything that I need.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I'm very happy.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh huh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Your welcome.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Is there anything else you need to know?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: No, Jeanne.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'll see you in Singapore then.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Right.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So have dinner at Bistro Moderne then.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay?

utterances.transcript: %Ah okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Thank you.

utterances.transcript: Okay.
